abs: Enterprises often need to assess and manage the risk arising from uncertainty in their data. Such uncertainty is typically modeled as a probability distribution over the uncertain data values, specified by means of a complex (often predictive) stochastic model. The probability distribution over data values leads to a probability dis- tribution over database query results, and risk assessment amounts to exploration of the upper or lower tail of a query-result distribu- tion. In this paper, we extend the Monte Carlo Database System to efficiently obtain a set of samples from the tail of a query-result distribution by adapting recent "Gibbs cloning" ideas from the sim- ulation literature to a database setting.
title: MCDB-R: Risk analysis in the database
